 [<span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎חָבַשׁ‎</span>] **verb** ==bind, bind on, bind up== (Late Hebrew ***id.***; Assyrian <abbr title="transliteration"><u>***abâšu,***</u></abbr> according to [[BDB#Dl|Dl]]<sup>W 70, Pr 174</sup>; Arabic <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> ***confine, restrict***; yet on Assyrian <abbr title="transliteration"><u>***—ibšu***</u></abbr> ***'Kopfbinde'*** (with <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎חֿ‎</span>), etc., see [[BDB#Zehnpf|Zehnpf]]<sup>BAS i. 499, 526</sup>; Aramaic <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,">; compare <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,">, <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎חֲבוּשְׁיָא‎</span> ***imprisonment***, etc.) — 

**Qal** ***Perfect*** 2 masculine singular <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וְחָבַשְׁתָּ֫‎</span> [[Exod.29.9|Exod 29:9]] 2 masculine plural <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎חֲבַשְׁתֶּם‎</span> [[Ezek.34.4|Ezek 34:4]] ***Imperfect*** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎יַחֲבוֺשׁ‎</span> [[Job.34.17|Job 34:17]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וַיַּחֲבשׁ‎</span> [[Gen.22.3|Gen 22:3]] + 4 t.; <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וַיַּחֲבָשֿׁ‎</span> [[1Kgs.13.23|1Kgs 13:23]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וְיֶחְבָּ֑שׁ‎</span> [[Job.5.18|Job 5:18]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וַיַּחְבְּשֵׁנוּ‎</span> [[Hos.6.1|Hos 6:1]] 3 feminine singular <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וַתַחֲבשׁ‎</span> [[2Kgs.4.24|2Kgs 4:24]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אֶחֱבשׁ‎</span> [[Ezek.34.16|Ezek 34:16]] cohortative <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אֶחְבְּשָׁהֿ‎</span> [[2Sam.19.27|2Sam 19:27]] (but compare below); <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וָאֶחְבְּשֵׁךְ‎</span> [[Ezek.16.10|Ezek 16:10]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וַיַּחְבְּשׁוֿ‎</span> [[1Kgs.13.13|1Kgs 13:13]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וַיַּחֲב֑שׁו‎</span> [[1Kgs.13.27|1Kgs 13:27]] ***Imperative*** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎חֲבשׁ‎</span> [[Job.40.13|Job 40:13]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎חֲבוֺשׁ‎</span> [[Ezek.24.17|Ezek 24:17]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎חִבְשׁוּ‎</span> [[1Kgs.13.13|1Kgs 13:13]]; [[1Kgs.13.27|1Kgs 13:27]] ***Infinitive construct*** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎חֲבשׁ‎</span> [[Isa.30.26|Isa 30:26]]; [[Isa.61.1|Isa 61:1]]<span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לְחָבְּשָׁהּ‎</span> [[Ezek.30.21|Ezek 30:21]] (strike out [[BDB#Co|Co]], compare [[BDB#Sept|ᵐ5]]). ***Participle active*** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎חֹבֵשׁ‎</span> [[Isa.3.7|Isa 3:7]] ***passive*** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎חָבוּשׁ‎</span> [[Jonah.2.6|Jonah 2:6]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎חֲבוּשִׁים‎</span> [[Judg.19.10|Judg 19:10]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎חֲבֻשִׁים‎</span> [[2Sam.16.1|2Sam 16:1]]; [[Ezek.27.24|Ezek 27:24]] — 

**1.** ***bind, bind on:*** 
$\quad$ $\quad$ **a.** headgear, with accusative of thing, <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לְ‎</span> person [[Exod.29.9|Exod 29:9]]; [[Lev.8.13|Lev 8:13]] (both [[BDB#P|P]]); with <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎על‎</span> person [[Ezek.24.17|Ezek 24:17]] ([[BDB#P|P]]); ***passive*** of seaweeds clinging about head <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎סוּף חָבוּשׁ‎</span> <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לְראֹשִׁי‎</span> [[Jonah.2.6|Jonah 2:6]] with suffix person and <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎בְּ‎</span> of thing <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וָאֶחְבְּשֵׁךְ‎</span> [[Ezek.16.10|Ezek 16:10]] ***and I bound*** (or ***wound***) ***about thee*** (i.e. thy head, [[BDB#Sm|Sm]] [[BDB#VB|VB]]) <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎שֵׁשׁ‎</span> (in metaphor of <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎י‎</span>'s care for Jerusalem; \|\| <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אַלְבִּישֵׁךְ‎</span>, <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אֶנְעֲלֵךְ‎</span>); figurative of punishment for wicked <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎פְּנֵיהֶם חֲבשׁ בטמון‎</span> [[Job.40.13|Job 40:13]] ***bind their faces in darkness*** (\|\| <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎טָמְנֵם בֶּעָפָר‎</span>) see [[BDB#Di|Di]]. 
$\quad$ $\quad$ **b.** passive probably ***twined, twisted*** in <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎חֲבָלִים חֲבֻשִׁים וַאֲרֻזִים‎</span> [[Ezek.27.24|Ezek 27:24]], ***cords twisted and strong***, see [[BDB#Sm|Sm]] [[BDB#Da|Da]]. Especially 
$\quad$ $\quad$ **c.** of equipping a beast for riding; ass, in accusative [[Gen.22.3|Gen 22:3]]; [[Num.22.21|Num 22:21]] (both [[BDB#E|E]]), [[2Sam.17.23|2Sam 17:23]] &amp; [[2Sam.19.27|2Sam 19:27]] (where however read <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לוֺ חָבְשָׁהלִּֿי‎</span>, so [[BDB#Sept|ᵐ5]] [[BDB#Syr|ᵑ6]] [[BDB#Vg|ᵑ9]] [[BDB#The|Th]] [[BDB#We|We]] [[BDB#Dr|Dr]]), [[1Kgs.2.40|1Kgs 2:40]]; [[1Kgs.13.13|1Kgs 13:13]] (twice in verse); [[1Kgs.13.23|1Kgs 13:23]]; [[1Kgs.13.27|1Kgs 13:27]] (twice in verse) ([[1Kgs.13.27|1Kgs 13:27]] b no direct object expressed) [[2Kgs.4.24|2Kgs 4:24]] passive, also of asses, [[Judg.19.10|Judg 19:10]]; [[2Sam.16.1|2Sam 16:1]]. 
$\quad$ $\quad$ **d.** figurative = ***restrain, control*** (German ***bändigen***), absolute [[Job.34.17|Job 34:17]]. 

**2.** ***bind up***, namely a wound, usually in figure, of comforting the distressed, etc.; with suffix person [[Hos.6.1|Hos 6:1]] (\|\| <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎רָפָא‎</span>, opposed to <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הִכָּה‎</span>); followed by <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לְ‎</span> person <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לַחֲבשׁ לְנִשְׁבְּרֵילֵֿב‎</span> [[Isa.61.1|Isa 61:1]] compare [[Ezek.34.4|Ezek 34:4]] (followed by <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לַנִּשְׁבֶּרֶת‎</span>; \|\| <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎חַזֵּק‎</span>, <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎רִפֵּא‎</span>), v[[Ezek.34.16|Ezek 34:16]] (followed by ***id.***; \|\| <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎חִזֵּק‎</span>); followed by accusative of thing <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎בְּיוֺם‎</span> <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אֶתשֶֿׁבֶר עַמּוֺ‎</span> <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎חֲבשׁ י‎</span> [[Isa.30.26|Isa 30:26]] (\|\| <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎רָפָא‎</span>); with accusative of Pharaoh's broken arm [[Ezek.30.21|Ezek 30:21]] (si vera lectio, see above; compare **Pu\`al**); absolute [[Job.5.18|Job 5:18]] also [[Isa.3.7|Isa 3:7]] of repairing fortunes of people (opposed to <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הִכְאִיב‎</span>; \|\| <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎רָפָה‎</span> = <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎רָפָא‎</span>). **Pi\`el** ***Perfect*** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎חִבֵּשׁ‎</span> ***bind, restrain*** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מִבְּכִי נהרות‎</span> [[Job.28.11|Job 28:11]] ***Participle*** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מְחַבֵּשׁ‎</span> ***bind up*** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לְעַצְבוֺתָם‎</span> [[Ps.147.3|Ps 147:3]]. **Pu\`al** ***Perfect be bound up*** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎חֻבְּשָׁה‎</span> [[Ezek.30.21|Ezek 30:21]] (metaphor) Pharaoh's broken arm; <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎חֻבָּ֑שׁוּ‎</span> [[Isa.1.6|Isa 1:6]] (wounds of land of Judah).
